intro: Psychotria biloba, commonly known as the "blue-dyed" psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It is often found growing in humid, shaded environments such as cloud forests. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological studies.
